intro: Bunium tenuisectum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed fennel, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Its aromatic seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Bunium tenuisectum is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining soil stability.
